homepage_h2:
daisyUI é o plugin Tailwind CSS que você vai adorar!
Ele fornece nomes de classe de componentes úteis
para ajudar você a escrever menos código e construir mais rápido.
In a Tailwind CSS project, you need to w: Em um projeto Tailwind CSS, você precisa escrever nomes de classes de utilitário para cada elemento. Milhares de nomes de classe apenas para estilizar os elementos mais básicos.
instead of writing<br /> <span class='te:
em vez de escrever
100 nomes de classe
For every element, every page, every pro:
Para cada elemento, cada página, cada projeto,
novamente e novamente
It's descriptive, faster, cleaner and ea: É descritivo, mais rápido, mais limpo e mais fácil de manter.
Use Tailwind CSS but write fewer class n: Use Tailwind CSS, mas escreva menos nomes de classe.
daisyUI adds class names to Tailwind CSS:
daisyUI adiciona nomes de classes ao Tailwind CSS
para todos os componentes de IU comuns.
Nomes de classes como
This allows us to focus on important thi:
Isso nos permite focar em coisas importantes
em vez de estilizar elementos básicos para cada projeto.
Write fewer class names<br />Use compone:
Escreva menos nomes de classe
Use nomes de classe de componentes
modifique-os usando as classes do Tailwind CSS.
With daisyUI, you write 88% fewer class:
Com o daisyUI, você escreve 88% menos nomes de classe
E o tamanho do seu HTML será cerca de 79% menor.
Powered by Tailwind&nbsp;CSS utility&nbs: Alimentado por classes utilitárias do Tailwind CSS
daisyUI is built on top of Tailwind&nbsp: daisyUI é construído em cima do Tailwind CSS, para que você possa personalizar tudo usando classes utilitárias.
daisyUI is a plugin for Tailwind CSS. It: daisyUI é um plugin para o Tailwind CSS. Funciona em todos os frameworks JS e não precisa de um arquivo bundle JS.
Install daisyUI as a dev dependency and: Instale o daisyUI como uma dependência de desenvolvimento e use os nomes de classe como qualquer outro nome de classe do Tailwind CSS.
Your website should be unique. Create a: Seu site deve ser único. Crie um tema personalizado para você usando o gerador de temas daisyUI. As cores escolhidas serão aplicadas a todos os componentes daisyUI.
Mix and match daisyUI class names to cre: Combine nomes de classe daisyUI para criar páginas da web únicas.
daisyUI is the most popular<br />compone: daisyUI é a biblioteca de componentes mais popular para o Tailwind CSS
open-source projects using daisyUI: projetos de código aberto usando o daisyUI
Also, using semantic color names makes t: Além disso, o uso de nomes semânticos de cores facilita a criação de temas. Você não precisaria definir cores de modo escuro para cada elemento individual e não estaria limitado apenas a temas claros/escuros. Você pode ter vários temas disponíveis e cada tema é apenas algumas linhas de variáveis CSS.
Accordion is used for showing and hiding: Acordeão é usado para mostrar e ocultar conteúdo, mas apenas um item pode permanecer aberto por vez.
All radio inputs with the same name work: Todos os campos de seleção com o mesmo nome funcionam em conjunto e apenas um deles pode estar aberto de cada vez. Se tiver mais do que um conjunto de itens de acordeão numa página, use nomes diferentes para os campos de seleção em cada conjunto.
Alert informs users about important even: O alerta informa os usuários sobre eventos importantes.
Avatars are used to show a thumbnail rep: Os avatares são usados para mostrar uma representação em miniatura de um indivíduo ou empresa na interface.
Badges are used to inform the user of th: Os distintivos são usados para informar o usuário sobre o status de dados específicos.
Breadcrumbs helps users to navigate thro: As trilhas de navegação ajudam os usuários a navegar pelo site.
Buttons allow the user to take actions o: Os botões permitem que o usuário execute ações ou faça escolhas.
Cards are used to group and display cont: Os cards são usados para agrupar e exibir conteúdo de forma facilmente legível.
Carousel show images or content in a scr: O carrossel exibe imagens ou conteúdo em uma área rolável.
Chat bubbles are used to show one line o: As bolhas de bate-papo são usadas para mostrar uma linha de conversa e todos os seus dados, incluindo a imagem do autor, nome do autor, horário, etc.
Checkboxes are used to select or deselec: As caixas de seleção são usadas para selecionar ou desmarcar um valor.
Collapse is used for showing and hiding: O colapso é usado para mostrar e ocultar conteúdo.
Diff component shows a side-by-side comp: O componente Diferença mostra uma comparação lado a lado de dois itens.
Divider will be used to separate content: O divisor será usado para separar o conteúdo vertical ou horizontalmente.
Drawer is a grid layout that can show/hi: A gaveta é um layout de grade que pode mostrar/ocultar uma barra lateral no lado esquerdo ou direito da página.
Dropdown can open a menu or any other el: O dropdown pode abrir um menu ou qualquer outro elemento quando o botão é clicado.
File Input is a an input field for uploa: Input de arquivo é um campo de entrada para upload de arquivos.
Footer can contain logo, copyright notic: O rodapé pode conter um logotipo, aviso de direitos autorais e links para outras páginas.
Hero is a component for displaying a lar: O hero é um componente para exibir uma caixa grande ou imagem com título e descrição.
Indicators are used to place an element: Os indicadores são usados para posicionar um elemento no canto de outro elemento.
A entrada de texto é um campo de entrada simples.
Kbd is used to display keyboard shortcut: O kbd é usado para exibir atalhos de teclado.
Link adds the missing underline style to: O link adiciona o estilo de sublinhado ausente aos links.
Loading shows an animation to indicate t: Carregando mostra uma animação para indicar que algo está a carregar.
Mask crops the content of the element to: A máscara corta o conteúdo do elemento para formas comuns.
Menu is used to display a list of links: O menu é usado para exibir uma lista de links vertical ou horizontalmente.
Browser mockup shows a box that looks li: Simulação de navegador mostra uma caixa que se parece com uma janela de navegador.
Code mockup is used to show a block of c: A simulação de código é usada para mostrar um bloco de código em uma caixa que se parece com um editor de código.
Phone mockup shows a mockup of an iPhone: A simulação de telefone mostra um mockup de um iPhone.
Window mockup shows a box that looks lik: A simulação de janela mostra uma caixa que se parece com uma janela do sistema operacional.
Modal is used to show a dialog or a box: O modal é usado para exibir uma caixa de diálogo ou uma caixa quando você clica em um botão.
Navbar is used to show a navigation bar: A barra de navegação é usada para exibir uma barra de navegação no topo da página.
Pagination is a group of buttons that al: A paginação é um grupo de botões que permite ao usuário navegar entre um conjunto de conteúdo relacionado.
Progress bar can be used to show the pro: A barra de progresso pode ser usada para mostrar o progresso de uma tarefa ou a passagem do tempo.
Radial progress can be used to show the: O progresso radial pode ser usado para mostrar o progresso de uma tarefa ou a passagem do tempo.
Radio buttons allow the user to select o: Os botões de opção permitem que o usuário selecione uma opção de um conjunto.
Range slider is used to select a value b: O controle deslizante de intervalo é usado para selecionar um valor deslizando um controle.
Rating is a set of radio buttons that al: O rating é um conjunto de botões de opção que permite que o usuário avalie algo.
Select is used to pick a value from a li: O select é usado para escolher um valor de uma lista de opções.
Skeleton is a component that can be used: Esqueleto é um componente que pode ser usado para mostrar um estado de carregamento de um componente.
Stack visually puts elements on top of e: O stack coloca visualmente elementos um em cima do outro.
Steps can be used to show a list of step: Os steps podem ser usados para mostrar uma lista de etapas em um processo.
Swap allows you to toggle the visibility: O swap permite alternar a visibilidade de dois elementos usando uma caixa de seleção ou um nome de classe.
Tabs can be used to show a list of links: As tabs podem ser usadas para mostrar uma lista de links em um formato de abas.
Table can be used to show a list of data: A tabela pode ser usada para mostrar uma lista de dados em um formato tabular.
Textarea allows users to enter text in m: O textarea permite que os usuários insiram texto em várias linhas.
If a checked checkbox input or a checked: Se existir na página uma entrada de caixa de seleção marcada ou uma entrada de rádio marcada com a classe controlador de tema, a página terá o mesmo tema que o valor dessa entrada.
Timeline component shows a list of event: O componente Linha do Tempo mostra uma lista de eventos em ordem cronológica.
Toast is a wrapper to stack elements, po: Toast é um invólucro para empilhar elementos, posicionado no canto da página.
Toggle is a checkbox that is styled to l: O toggle é uma caixa de seleção estilizada para se parecer com um botão interruptor.
Tooltip can be used to show a message wh: O tooltip pode ser usado para exibir uma mensagem ao passar o mouse sobre um elemento.
Just add one of these to the <code>head<: Basta adicionar um desses dentro da tag head do seu HTML
How to use daisyUI from a CDN?: Como usar daisyUI de um CDN?
How to use daisyUI colors?: Como usar as cores do daisyUI?
daisyUI is fully themeable and colorable: O daisyUI é totalmente tematizável e colorido,
So instead of using constant color utili: Em vez de usar classes utilitárias de cor constante como:
It's suggested to use semantic color uti: É sugerido usar classes utilitárias de cor semântica como:
Each color name contains CSS variables a: Cada nome de cor contém variáveis CSS e cada tema do daisyUI aplica valores de cor às classes utilitárias quando é aplicado.
Semantic color names make more sense bec: Nomes semânticos de cores fazem mais sentido porque, ao projetar interfaces, não usamos apenas uma cor aleatória. Definimos uma paleta de cores específica com nomes como primary, secondary, etc. e usamos apenas essas cores específicas em nossas interfaces.
List of all daisyUI color names: Lista de todos os nomes de cores do daisyUI
You can use these color names in your th: Você pode usar esses nomes de cores em seu tema ou em classes utilitárias.
Some daisyUI components come with modifi: Alguns componentes do daisyUI vêm com nomes de classe modificadores e esse nome de classe modificadora aplicará uma cor.
You can also use color names in utility: Você também pode usar nomes de cores em classes utilitárias, assim como os nomes de cores originais do Tailwind.
These are utility classes that can be us: Essas são classes utilitárias que podem ser usadas com um nome de cor:
How to change the default configuration: Como alterar a configuração padrão do daisyUI?
How to customize daisyUI?: Como personalizar os componentes do daisyUI?
daisyUI components come with many varian: Os componentes do daisyUI vêm com muitas variantes necessárias para sistemas de design e você geralmente não precisa personalizar nada.
But you can still customize components i: Mas você ainda pode personalizar os componentes de várias maneiras.
Let's say, you want to customize this bu: Digamos que você queira personalizar este botão:
You can use daisyUI utility classes:: Você pode usar classes do daisyUI:
You can use Tailwind's utility classes:: Você pode usar as classes do Tailwind:
You can customize components on your CSS: Você pode personalizar os componentes em seu arquivo CSS, usando a diretiva @apply do Tailwind:
You need <a target=_blank' href='https:/: Você precisa ter o Node.js e o Tailwind CSS instalados.
How to install daisyUI as a Tailwind CSS: Como instalar o daisyUI como um plugin do Tailwind CSS?
See example setup of daisyUI and Tailwin: Veja exemplos de configuração do daisyUI e do Tailwind CSS em diferentes frameworks e ferramentas.
How to use layouts and typography in dai: Como usar layouts e tipografia no daisyUI
Layout, sizing, grids, spacing, etc. all: Layout, dimensionamento, grades, espaçamento, etc. tudo será tratado pelas classes utilitárias do Tailwind CSS
How to use a theme only for a section of: Como usar um tema apenas para uma seção de uma página?
Add <code>data-theme='THEME_NAME'</code>: Adicione data-theme='THEME_NAME' a qualquer elemento e tudo dentro terá seu tema.
You can nest themes and there is no limi: Você pode aninhar temas e não há limite!
You can force a section of your HTML to: Você pode fazer com que uma seção do seu HTML use apenas um tema específico.
How to add a new custom theme?: Como adicionar um novo tema personalizado?
How to add custom styles for a specific: Como adicionar estilos personalizados para um tema específico?
You can write custom style for your elem: Pode escrever estilo personalizado para os seus elementos apenas para um tema específico.
Add component classes to your HTML: Adicione classes de componentes ao seu HTML
How to use daisyUI classes to style your: Como usar as classes do daisyUI para customizar sua página?
Once you <a href='/docs/install/'>instal: Depois de ter instalado o daisyUI, você pode usar classes de componentes como btn, card, etc.
So instead of making a button using only: Então, em vez de criar um botão usando apenas classes
You can just use a component class like: Você pode simplesmente usar uma classe de componente assim
Then you can modify the component with d: Em seguida, você pode modificar o componente com classes adicionais do daisyUI
Or you can modify the component with Tai: Ou você pode modificar o componente com classes do Tailwind CSS
Utility classes and CSS variables: Classes de utilitários e variáveis CSS
These CSS variables are being used inter: Estas variáveis CSS estão sendo usadas internamente para um componente específico
To use a custom prefix, <a class='link': Para usar um prefixo personalizado, adicione sua string de prefixo à configuração
footer-tagline:
Biblioteca gratuita de componentes
para frameworks CSS baseados em classes CSS
daisyUI adds a set of customizable color: O daisyUI adiciona um conjunto de nomes de cores personalizáveis ao Tailwind CSS, e essas novas cores usam variáveis CSS para os valores. Usando os nomes de cores do daisyUI, você obtém o Modo Escuro e ainda mais temas sem adicionar um novo nome de classe.
install-step-1: Instale o daisyUI como um pacote Node
daisyUI welcomes contributions from deve: O daisyUI recebe contribuições de desenvolvedores de todo o mundo
This button will have different sizes on: This button will have different sizes on different browser viewpoints
Modal that closes when clicked outside: Modal that closes when clicked outside
If you set max-width or the list gets la: If you set max-width or the list gets larger than the container it will scroll
to join the items together and handle bo: to join the items together and handle border radius automatically
This collapse works with focus. When div: This collapse works with focus. When div loses focus, it gets closed
This collapse works with checkbox instea: This collapse works with checkbox instead of focus. It needs to get clicked again to get closed.
Use Tailwind CSS `group` and `group-focu: Use Tailwind CSS `group` and `group-focus` utilities to apply style when parent div is focused
Use Tailwind CSS `peer` and `peer-checke: Use Tailwind CSS `peer` and `peer-checked` utilities to apply style when sibling checkbox is checked
opens on click using ID.showModal() meth: opens on click using ID.showModal() method. can be closed using ID.close() method
there is a second form with 'modal-backd: there is a second form with 'modal-backdrop' class and it covers the screen so we can close the modal when clicked outside
You can use any w-* and max-w-* utility: You can use any w-* and max-w-* utility class to customize the width
Modal works with a hidden checkbox and l: Modal works with a hidden checkbox and labels can toggle the checkbox so we can use another label tag with 'modal-backdrop' class that covers the screen so we can close the modal when clicked outside
Dialog modal with a close button at corn: Dialog modal with a close button at corner
Instead of working with click, it shows: Instead of working with click, it shows swap-on item if you add swap-active class name. You can add or remove swap-active class using JS

daisyUI provides a few useful utility cl: daisyUI provides a few useful utility classes and CSS variables to help you use the library more effectively.

There are 3 ways to add daisyUI to your: There are 3 ways to add daisyUI to your Rails project
Initialize a package.json (if you don't: Initialize a package.json (if you don't have one) and install daisyUI
Run this code to download latest version: Run this code to download latest version of daisyUI as a single js file
This method is recommended if you want t: This method is recommended if you want to quickly add daisyUI without adding any file.
Now you can use daisyUI class names! Let: Now you can use daisyUI class names! Let's create a simple page and try a button
What's the difference between daisyUI an: What's the difference between daisyUI and Tailwind CSS?
Is daisyUI aligned with Tailwind CSS' ut: Is daisyUI aligned with Tailwind CSS' utility-first philosophy?
How does daisyUI fit in Atomic Design pr: How does daisyUI fit in Atomic Design principles?
Can I use daisyUI without Tailwind CSS?: Can I use daisyUI without Tailwind CSS?
Can I use daisyUI with other UI framewor: Can I use daisyUI with other UI frameworks?
Which frameworks can I use daisyUI with?: Which frameworks can I use daisyUI with?
daisyUI uses the Tailwind CSS plugin API: daisyUI uses the Tailwind CSS plugin API to extend the available Tailwind CSS class names. This means that daisyUI is fully compatible with Tailwind CSS and you can use it with any Tailwind CSS project.
daisyUI is for you if you:: daisyUI is for you if you:
Are tired of writing thousands of utilit: Are tired of writing thousands of utility class names repeatedly
Want more readable and maintainable code: Want more readable and maintainable code
Need to design interfaces faster with le: Need to design interfaces faster with less code
Want a consistent design system across p: Want a consistent design system across projects
Want to use standard UI parts, without m: Want to use standard UI parts, without making design decisions for every single detail
Want dark mode and many other themes ava: Want dark mode and many other themes available out of the box
Want to use a design system that is base: Want to use a design system that is based on real-world UI design principles
Want development speed and customization: Want development speed and customization at the same time
daisyUI is not for you if you:: daisyUI is not for you if you:
Want to waste time re-inventing all the: Want to waste time re-inventing all the standard UI parts like buttons, cards, checkboxes, etc, for each project.
Want to swim in the ocean of thousands o: Want to swim in the ocean of thousands of class names and never find your way out.
Want to make your codebase a mess and sp: Want to make your codebase a mess and spend hours figuring out what part of the code is responsible for what part of the UI.
Want to waste your time and money re-inv: Want to waste your time and money re-inventing the wheel instead of shipping your actual project.
For example Tailwind CSS class names dec: For example Tailwind CSS class names decide if padding should be 4px or 8px. daisyUI class names decide if a HTML element should look like a `card`, a `button`, a `toggle`, etc, just like what we would call them semantically in a design system.
This makes it easier to design interface: This makes it easier to design interfaces with less code and more consistency. For example if you want to make a card using Tailwind CSS you would have to write one or multiple utility class names for each single CSS rule. Doing this over and over again for each element, for each page, for each project is time consuming and hard to manage. It also makes it harder to maintain your code as you have to always figure out what part of the code is responsible for what part of the UI.
daisyUI is not a replacement for Tailwin: daisyUI is not a replacement for Tailwind CSS, it's a plugin that makes Tailwind CSS more powerful and easier to use.
We need customization development speed: We need customization development speed at the same time. daisyUI is here to make this possible.
Atomic Design is a methodology for creat: Atomic Design is a methodology for creating design systems. It breaks down the UI into smaller parts, like atoms, molecules, organisms, etc.
You can think of Tailwind CSS utility cl: You can think of Tailwind CSS utility classes as atoms. They are the smallest parts of the UI that you can use to build larger parts. daisyUI classes are like molecules and organisms. They are higher-level abstractions of the UI parts that are made of atoms.
Larger parts of the UI, like templates a: Larger parts of the UI, like templates and pages are quickly possible by putting these molecules and organisms together in layouts, using grid or flexbox, and adding functionality and content to them.
Yes, daisyUI is free and open-source, un: Yes, daisyUI is free and open-source, under the MIT license. You can use it in any project, commercial or non-commercial, without any restrictions.
Why is it free? daisyUI's goal is to imp: Why is it free? daisyUI's goal is to improve the web development experience for everyone. I believe web development is already complex enough with all the different technologies, frameworks and tools. It takes a lot of time and effort to learn and master all these tools. daisyUI is here to make the design part of web development easier and faster, so you can focus on the actual product you are building.
You can support daisyUI by using it in y: You can support daisyUI by using it in your projects, sharing it with your friends and colleagues, and contributing to the project on GitHub. You can also support daisyUI by becoming a sponsor on GitHub or Open Collective.
Alternatively if you don't want to use T: Alternatively if you don't want to use Tailwind CSS, you can use daisyUI for components and write your own styles for layout, spacing, etc.
Yes, you can mix and match daisyUI with: Yes, you can mix and match daisyUI with any UI framework that add styles based on class names. If there's any class name conflict, you can use prefix to avoid conflicts between two libraries.
ALL of them! daisyUI is framework agnost: ALL of them! daisyUI is framework agnostic. You can use it anywhere you can use CSS.
daisyUI can be configured from your CSS: daisyUI can be configured from your CSS file.
In above example, we enable all themes.
In above example, we disable all themes. it's useful to disable all themes and add custom themes using
In above example, we set dracula as the: In above example, we set dracula as the default theme. setting one value like this means only one theme will be available. Unless you add custom themes using
In above example, we disable the logs of: In above example, we disable the logs of daisyUI. This is useful if you want to clean up the console output.
string or comma separated list or `false: string or comma separated list or `false` or `all`
List of themes to enable. Use `false` to: List of themes to enable. Use `false` to disable all themes. Use `all` to enable all themes. Add `--default` flag next to a theme name to set it as default theme. Add `--prefersdark` flag next to a theme name to set it as default theme for dark mode.
The CSS selector to receive the CSS vari: The CSS selector to receive the CSS variables.
You can also control the opacity of the: You can also control the opacity of the color like
Change the theme to see the border radiu: Change the theme to see the border radius changes:
creates a glass effect on the element.
For advanced use: These CSS variables ar: For advanced use: These CSS variables are being used internally for a specific components. You probably won't need to customize them, but you can if you want to.
These variables are for internal use. Th: These variables are for internal use. They are not subject of semantic versioning and some of them may be modified or removed in future minor versions, in which case your custom styles might lose their effect, so if you want to modify these variables and your UI really depends on the customized value, make sure you are using a fixed version of daisyUI, not the latest version.
Sets the background color to the primary: Sets the background color to the primary color
Sets the ending color for a gradient to: Sets the ending color for a gradient to the primary color
Sets the middle color for a gradient to: Sets the middle color for a gradient to the primary color
Sets the starting color for a gradient t: Sets the starting color for a gradient to the primary color
Sets the text color to the primary color: Sets the text color to the primary color
Sets the ring color to the primary color: Sets the ring color to the primary color
Sets the fill color for SVG elements to: Sets the fill color for SVG elements to the primary color
Sets the caret color to the primary colo: Sets the caret color to the primary color
Sets the stroke color for SVG elements t: Sets the stroke color for SVG elements to the primary color
Sets the border color to the primary col: Sets the border color to the primary color
Sets the color for dividing borders to t: Sets the color for dividing borders to the primary color
Sets the accent color to the primary col: Sets the accent color to the primary color
Sets the shadow color to the primary col: Sets the shadow color to the primary color
Sets the outline color to the primary co: Sets the outline color to the primary color
Sets the text decoration color to the pr: Sets the text decoration color to the primary color
Sets the placeholder text color to the p: Sets the placeholder text color to the primary color
Sets the ring offset color to the primar: Sets the ring offset color to the primary color
For large sized components like card, mo: For large sized components like card, modal, alert, etc.
For medium sized components like button,: For medium sized components like button, input, select, tab, etc.
For small sized components like checkbox: For small sized components like checkbox, toggle, badge, etc.

Here's a demo text to demonstrate the Ta: Here's a demo text to demonstrate the Tailwind CSS Typography plugin in combination with daisyUI colors:
This is a demo of the Tailwind CSS Typog: This is a demo of the Tailwind CSS Typography plugin in action. The plugin provides a set of prose classes that can be used to style your HTML content with minimal effort. When combined with daisyUI, you get access to a variety of themes that are fully compatible with the Typography plugin.
Headers are essential for structuring yo: Headers are essential for structuring your content and making it easy to read. With Tailwind CSS Typography and daisyUI, you can create headers that stand out and match your chosen theme.
Text formatting is crucial for emphasizi: Text formatting is crucial for emphasizing important information. Tailwind CSS Typography makes it simple to apply bold, italic, and other text styles.
Blockquotes are an excellent way to high: Blockquotes are an excellent way to highlight quotes or important information. They are styled beautifully with the Typography plugin.
Lists are a great way to organize inform: Lists are a great way to organize information in a structured manner. Tailwind CSS Typography makes it easy to create both unordered and ordered lists.
Unordered lists use bullet points to lis: Unordered lists use bullet points to list items. They are perfect for listing items without a specific order.
Ordered lists use numbers to list items. They are ideal for steps or items that need to be in a specific order.
Links are essential for navigation and a: Links are essential for navigation and adding interactivity to your content. Tailwind CSS Typography ensures that links are styled consistently.
Images are a great way to enhance your c: Images are a great way to enhance your content visually. The Typography plugin makes sure they are displayed beautifully.
Code snippets are crucial for technical: Code snippets are crucial for technical content. Tailwind CSS Typography provides excellent styling for both inline code and code blocks.
Inline code is perfect for highlighting: Inline code is perfect for highlighting small pieces of code within a sentence.
Here is an example of inline code:: Here is an example of inline code:
Code blocks are ideal for displaying lar: Code blocks are ideal for displaying larger pieces of code. You can use Shiki, Prism or other libraries for code highlighting.
Tables are essential for organizing data: Tables are essential for organizing data in rows and columns. Tailwind CSS Typography ensures that tables are styled consistently and look great.
daisyUI provides various color schemes t: daisyUI provides various color schemes that you can use to add vibrancy to your content. Here are some examples:
Styling your Markdown-generated HTML has: Styling your Markdown-generated HTML has never been easier, thanks to the Tailwind CSS Typography plugin and daisyUI themes. By using headers, text formatting, lists, links, images, code snippets, tables, and colors, you can create rich and visually appealing content with minimal effort. Experiment with these elements and see how they look with different daisyUI themes. Happy styling!
Tailwind CSS plugin for styling HTML: Tailwind CSS plugin for styling HTML
These are the tiny base styles that dais: These are the tiny base styles that daisyUI adds to your page. These styles are less than a kilobyte in total, so you don't need to worry about the size

For `:root` and `[data-theme]` it sets b: For `:root` and `[data-theme]` it sets background-color to `base-100` and text color to `base-content`
Sets `:root` to `overflow: hidden` when: Sets `:root` to `overflow: hidden` when modal or drawer is open
Adds a `scrollbar-gutter` to `:root` whe: Adds a `scrollbar-gutter` to `:root` when modal or drawer is open, to avoid layout shift
Contains small SVG images for noise filt: Contains small SVG images for noise filter, chat bubble tail mask, and tooltip tail mask. Can be disabled to use custom images.

writing an invalid email address applies: writing an invalid email address applies error color to the input. Valid email address applies success color.

Click the button before picking an optio: Click the button before picking an option to see the error color.
Even if join-item is not a direct child: Even if join-item is not a direct child of the group, it still gets the style
We can use input class for the parent an: We can use input class for the parent and put anything inside it
collapse-open and collapse-close doesn't: collapse-open and collapse-close doesn't work with this method. You can add/remove open attribute to the details instead

Use toggle class for a label, put a chec: Use toggle class for a label, put a checkbox and 2 icons inside it.
square aspect ratio or with rounded corn: square aspect ratio or with rounded corners
you can open/close the submenu by adding: you can open/close the submenu by adding/removing menu-dropdown-show class using JS

Use this if you can't use a HTML form fo: Use this if you can't use a HTML form for some reason

Modal goes bottom on SM screen size, goe: Modal goes bottom on SM screen size, goes middle on MD screen size
A hidden checkbox can control the state: A hidden checkbox can control the state of modal and labels can toggle the checkbox so we can open/close the modal.

Put Tailwind CSS and daisyUI in your CSS: Put Tailwind CSS and daisyUI in your CSS file at `src/` (and remove old styles).
Install WordPress according to the [Offi: Install WordPress according to the [Official WordPress guide](https://wordpress.org/download/).
In this guide, we will use the [WindPres: In this guide, we will use the [WindPress](https://wind.press) plugin to install Tailwind CSS and daisyUI in a WordPress project.
Navigate to the `Plugins → Add New Plugi: Navigate to the `Plugins → Add New Plugin` sub-menu.
Search for the WordPress plugin by typin: Search for the WordPress plugin by typing `WindPress` in the search bar.
Click the `Install Now` button to instal: Click the `Install Now` button to install the WordPress plugin.
Once the plugin is installed, click the: Once the plugin is installed, click the `Activate` button to activate the WindPress plugin.
Navigate to the WindPress dashboard by c: Navigate to the WindPress dashboard by clicking the `WindPress` menu item in the WordPress admin sidebar.
Then, click the `main.css` file on the e: Then, click the `main.css` file on the explorer sidebar to open the file editor.
Add daisyUI at the end of code in the `m: Add daisyUI at the end of code in the `main.css` file
Follow [Tailwind CSS guide](https://tail: Follow [Tailwind CSS guide](https://tailwindcss.com/blog/standalone-cli) and get the latest version of Tailwind CSS executable.
Add Tailwind CSS and daisyUI to your CSS: Add Tailwind CSS and daisyUI to your CSS file.
Address your HTML and other markup files: Address your HTML and other markup files in the `source` function.
Initialize a new Node project in the cur: Initialize a new Node project in the current directory using `npm init -y` if it's not a Node project already.
This command creates a `public/output.cs: This command creates a `public/output.css` file with the compiled CSS. You can link this file to your HTML file.
Create a new Angular project called `my-: Create a new Angular project called `my-project` and navigate to it
Add Tailwind CSS plugin for PostCSS to a: Add Tailwind CSS plugin for PostCSS to a new `.postcssrc.json` file at root
This guide uses daisyUI as a Node.js dep: This guide uses daisyUI as a Node.js dependency. If you don't want to use Node.js, try the [CDN version of daisyUI](/docs/cdn/).
Using Bun 1.2.4+ you can serve HTML and: Using Bun 1.2.4+ you can serve HTML and CSS files directly in a [dev server](https://bun.sh/docs/bundler/fullstack). Here's how to setup daisyUI for it.
Create a `bunfig.toml` file at root and: Create a `bunfig.toml` file at root and add bun-plugin-tailwind as a plugin
Create `style.css` at root, add Tailwind: Create `style.css` at root, add Tailwind CSS and daisyUI
Install PHP, Composer and Laravel Instal: Install PHP, Composer and Laravel Installer according to the [official Laravel documentation](https://laravel.com/docs/12.x/installation#creating-a-laravel-project)
Install Ruby on Rails according to the [: Install Ruby on Rails according to the [official Rails guide](https://guides.rubyonrails.org/getting_started.html).
This method is recommended if are alread: This method is recommended if are already using Node.js.
This works as a Tailwind CSS plugin so o: This works as a Tailwind CSS plugin so only the class names you need will be added to your CSS file.
This method is recommended if you are no: This method is recommended if you are not using Node.js.
You can [choose the parts you need](/doc: You can [choose the parts you need](/docs/cdn/)
daisyUI is a collection of CSS class nam: daisyUI is a collection of CSS class names. These class names are a high-level abstraction of Tailwind CSS utility classes.
Imagine you use Tailwind CSS with superp: Imagine you use Tailwind CSS with superpowers!
daisyUI is a NPM package, you can instal: daisyUI is a NPM package, you can install it as a dev dependency in your project.
Then you add it to Tailwind CSS as a plu: Then you add it to Tailwind CSS as a plugin. This makes all the daisyUI class names available to Tailwind CSS and you can use them like any other Tailwind CSS class names.
Tailwind CSS provides low-level utility: Tailwind CSS provides low-level utility classes, which usually include only one CSS rule.
daisyUI classes are a combination of mul: daisyUI classes are a combination of multiple CSS rule that are named semantically for each part of the UI.
daisyUI solves this problem by providing: daisyUI solves this problem by providing higher level class names that are named based on the UI parts. For example to make a card, we simply use the `card` class name and daisyUI gives you all the necessary CSS rules to make a card. Then if you need additional customization, you can add Tailwind CSS utility classes to the element to make it look the way you want.
daisyUI is built on top of Tailwind CSS': daisyUI is built on top of Tailwind CSS's component API. Tailwind CSS as a library provides utility classes and suggests using utility classes for maximum flexibility and customization. However that's means slower development and more code to write.
That's why many people find it hard to u: That's why many people find it hard to use Tailwind CSS for designing interfaces. It takes a professional designer to make design decisions for many details of the UI to make them look good. It also takes a lot of time to write all the utility class names for each part of the UI. Even copying and pasting those huge chunks of utility class names is not helpful, as it makes the codebase hard to read and maintain.
Imagine one side of the spectrum is maxi: Imagine one side of the spectrum is maximum customization and flexibility and you should make design decisions for every single detail. On the other side of the spectrum is maximum development speed and less code to write, but you have no control over the design. daisyUI and Tailwind CSS together give you the best of both worlds.
Use daisyUI class names to write less co: Use daisyUI class names to write less code and develop faster, and use Tailwind CSS utility classes to customize the design when you need to.
If you've been using Bootstrap many year: If you've been using Bootstrap many years ago, you may think it doesn't make sense to go back to using components.
But here's the catch: The problem with B: But here's the catch: The problem with Bootstrap was not class names! Bootstrap class names were actually really fast to work with. The problem was lack of customization and flexibility. At some point every Bootstrap website looked the same unless you open a CSS file and write tons of custom CSS.
Tailwind CSS solves this problem of cust: Tailwind CSS solves this problem of customization and flexibility but the cost is slower development and more code to write! You wanted customization and flexibility? Good luck making design decisions for every single pixel in your page! Not a practical approach, right?
Yes, daisyUI can be used standalone with: Yes, daisyUI can be used standalone without Tailwind CSS. However, it's recommended to use daisyUI with Tailwind CSS. Here's why:
daisyUI provides pieces of UI you can us: daisyUI provides pieces of UI you can use to make a website. Like Button, Toggle, Card, etc. You need something to glue these pieces together! For example you need flex box, grid, padding, margin, etc. Tailwind CSS provides these low-level utility classes that you can use to glue the UI pieces together. So daisyUI and Tailwind CSS are a perfect match. You can use daisyUI to design the UI parts and Tailwind CSS for layout, spacing, font-size and other low-level CSS rules.
In above example, we have 4 themes: `nor: In above example, we have 4 themes: `nord`, `abyss`, `cupcake`, and `dracula`. nord is the default theme, abyss is the default theme for dark mode, and cupcake and dracula are available to use with `data-theme="cupcake"` and `data-theme="dracula"`.
In above example, we disable all themes. it's useful to disable all themes and add custom themes using [`@plugin "daisyui/theme"`](/docs/themes/#how-to-add-a-new-custom-theme)
In above example, we set dracula as the: In above example, we set dracula as the default theme. setting one value like this means only one theme will be available. Unless you add custom themes using [`@plugin "daisyui/theme"`](/docs/themes/#how-to-add-a-new-custom-theme)
In above example, we set the CSS variabl: In above example, we set the CSS variables on `#my-app` instead of `:root`. This way all daisyUI global CSS variables will be scoped to `#my-app`.
This is useful to use daisyUI in a scope: This is useful to use daisyUI in a scoped environment like a web component or a shadow DOM or a specific part of the page.
In above example, we only include the bu: In above example, we only include the button, input, and select components. All other styles of daisyUI library will be excluded.
[Here are the file names you can include: [Here are the file names you can include or exclude](https://github.com/saadeghi/daisyui/tree/master/packages/daisyui/src).
In above example, we exclude the `rootsc: In above example, we exclude the `rootscrollgutter` style which is added to the `:root` when a modal or drawer is open.
In above example, we exclude the the lis: In above example, we exclude the the listed files. All other parts of daisyUI will be available to use. This is useful if you want to opt out of some parts of daisyUI or if you want to mix daisyUI for some parts and another library for the rest.
In above example, all daisyUI classes wi: In above example, all daisyUI classes will be prefixed with `d-`. For example, `btn` will be `d-btn`.
Using Tailwind CSS and daisyUI, it is ex: Using Tailwind CSS and daisyUI, it is expected for CSS files to be very small. Ideally only the class names you used must be in the CSS file. Sometimes (specially in monorepos) it is possible that [Tailwind CSS automatic class name detection](https://tailwindcss.com/docs/detecting-classes-in-source-files) finds some unwanted strings in your project and generate styles for them. To avoid this, you can [disable automatic detection](https://tailwindcss.com/docs/detecting-classes-in-source-files#disabling-automatic-detection) and register your source files using `@source` directive.
Probably you're using `@tailwindcss/form: Probably you're using `@tailwindcss/forms` (or another style or plugin) that is affecting form elements.
daisyUI applies styles to class names bu: daisyUI applies styles to class names but `@tailwindcss/forms` by default, applies styles to all form elements.
If you really need `@tailwindcss/forms`: If you really need `@tailwindcss/forms` alongside with daisyUI (which I doubt, because both are doing the same job) consider using its [`strategy: 'class'` config](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss-forms#using-only-global-styles-or-only-classes) so it only applies style to the elements with specific class name (not all form elements)
If you're using a custom theme make sure: If you're using a custom theme make sure you're using [all the required CSS variables](https://daisyui.com/docs/themes/#how-to-add-a-new-custom-theme)
With daisyUI, you don't need to manually: With daisyUI, you don't need to manually set colors using [`dark:` variant](https://daisyui.com/docs/colors/)
As long as you use [daisyUI colors](http: As long as you use [daisyUI colors](https://daisyui.com/docs/colors/) they will work on all themes, light or dark.
If you really want to use Tailwind's `da: If you really want to use Tailwind's `dark:` variant, [here's how to do it](https://daisyui.com/docs/themes/#how-to-apply-tailwinds-dark-selector-for-specific-themes).
All daisyUI colors can be used as utilit: All daisyUI colors can be used as utility classes. Just like any other Tailwind CSS color.
For example you can use `primary` color: For example you can use `primary` color with any of Tailwind CSS color utilities.
You can use `bg-primary` to set the back: You can use `bg-primary` to set the background color to the primary color and `text-primary-content` to set the text color to the primary color.
Tailwind CSS provides fixed values for b: Tailwind CSS provides fixed values for border radius, such as `rounded-sm`, `rounded-lg`, `rounded-xl`, etc.
daisyUI provides a few more border radiu: daisyUI provides a few more border radius values which are tokenized for components and can be customized based on the theme.
`glass` creates a glass effect on the el: `glass` creates a glass effect on the element.
These CSS variables can be customized fo: These CSS variables can be customized for each themes. Read more about [color names](/docs/colors).
If you are using a prefix for daisyUI, t: If you are using a prefix for daisyUI, these CSS variables will be prefixed with that prefix as well. For example if prefix is `daisy-`, The  `--alert-color` CSS variable will be `--daisy-alert-color`.
Every part of daisyUI is [available on C: Every part of daisyUI is [available on CDN](https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/daisyui@5/) as separate CSS files.
These components automatically set the c: These components automatically set the correct background color, text color, border color, etc as needed so you don't need to set those colors manually. For example `btn-primary` sets `primary` color for background and border, and sets `primary-content` color for the text automatically as default. You can customize them using utility classes if you want to change the color.
So you can use `bg-primary`, `border-sec: So you can use `bg-primary`, `border-secondary`, etc. Read more about [daisyUI color utility classes](/docs/utilities).
Sometimes we need a muted text. somethin: Sometimes we need a muted text. something with less contrast. The best way to do this is using Tailwind CSS color opacity modifier by adding a `/50` (or any other value) to the end of color name. Like `text-base-content/50`
The advantage of using opacity is that i: The advantage of using opacity is that it gives a constant result on all themes, for all colors.
You can use it with any opacity value, y: You can use it with any opacity value, you can use it for any color. For example primary-content:
You can also create your own custom them: You can also create your own custom themes or customize built-in themes.
You can manage themes by adding brackets: You can manage themes by adding brackets in front of `@plugin "daisyui"` in your CSS file.
`themes` is a comma-separated list of th: `themes` is a comma-separated list of theme names you want to enable.
You can set `--default` flag for a theme: You can set `--default` flag for a theme to make it the default theme.
You can also set `--prefersdark` flag fo: You can also set `--prefersdark` flag for a theme to make it the default theme for dark mode (prefers-color-scheme: dark).
By default, `light` and `dark` themes ar: By default, `light` and `dark` themes are enabled. Let's enable `cupcake` theme:
And set `cupcake` theme for the page:: And set `cupcake` theme for the page:
To disable `dark` theme for example, rem: To disable `dark` theme for example, remove it from the list. Now only light theme is included:
If for some reason you want to disable a: If for some reason you want to disable all themes and remove all daisyUI colors, set `themes` to `false`:
To customize a built-in theme, you can u: To customize a built-in theme, you can use the same structure as adding a new theme, but with the same name as the built-in theme. For example, to customize the `light` theme:
If you want to opt out of each part, you: If you want to opt out of each part, you can do it by setting the [`exclude` config](/docs/config/#exclude).
For example, to opt out of the scrollbar: For example, to opt out of the scrollbar-gutter and style, scrollbar-color, you can exclude it like this:
Or if you're using CDN, you can disable: Or if you're using CDN, you can disable it from your [customized CDN file](/docs/cdn/) if you need to.
[daisyui.com/llms.txt](https://daisyui.c: [daisyui.com/llms.txt](https://daisyui.com/llms.txt) file is a compact, text version of daisyUI docs to help AI generate accurate daisyUI code based on your prompt.
Here's how to use daisyUI llms.txt in yo: Here's how to use daisyUI llms.txt in your code editor:
Copilot can generate daisyUI code for yo: Copilot can generate daisyUI code for you.
Add daisyUI's llms.txt file to your repo: Add daisyUI's llms.txt file to your repo so that Copilot can use it by default.
Run this command to save the llms.txt fi: Run this command to save the llms.txt file to `.vscode/daisyui.md`
Now in chat window you can type `@daisyu: Now in chat window you can type `@daisyui` to provide daisyUI docs to Cursor.
details and summary are native HTML elem: details and summary are native HTML elements that can be used to create dropdowns.
Dropdown using details and summary opens: Dropdown using details and summary opens and closes the content when the summary is clicked. You can also open/close it using JS by adding/removing the `open` attribute
Popover API is the new HTML standard for: Popover API is the new HTML standard for creating dropdowns. It opens the dropdown on a top layer, which means there's no need to z-index management and there's no overflow issue.
Anchor positioning is a new CSS standard: Anchor positioning is a new CSS standard for positioning elements relative to an anchor.
`popovertarget` is the unique ID of the: `popovertarget` is the unique ID of the popover content.
`anchor-name`/`position-anchor` is the u: `anchor-name`/`position-anchor` is the unique name of the anchor.
CSS Anchor Positioning is a new standard: CSS Anchor Positioning is a new standard but isn't yet supported in Firefox and Safari ([caniuse.com](https://caniuse.com/css-anchor-positioning)).
In those browsers, the dropdown will app: In those browsers, the dropdown will appear centered like a modal.
There's also [this polyfill](https://git: There's also [this polyfill](https://github.com/oddbird/css-anchor-positioning) that can be helpful.
Safari has a [CSS bug](https://bugs.webk: Safari has a [CSS bug](https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=22261) since 2008 that prevents button elements from being focused, so we use div `tabindex="0"` as a workaround.
This approach is accessible with the add: This approach is accessible with the addition of `role="button"` and functions consistently across all browsers.
A normal text and a helper dropdown: A normal text and a helper dropdown
Drawer is a grid layout that can show/hi: Drawer is a grid layout that can show/hide a sidebar on the left or right side of the page, based on the screen size or based on the value of a `drawer-toggle` checkbox.
Drawer must be the parent element of the: Drawer must be the parent element of the content and sidebar.
Drawer sidebar is hidden by default.
You can make it visible on larger screen: You can make it visible on larger screens using `lg:drawer-open` class (or using other responsive prefixes: sm, md, lg, xl)
You can check/uncheck the checkbox using: You can check/uncheck the checkbox using JavaScript or by clicking the `label` tag which is assigned to the hidden checkbox
Opening a drawer adds a [scrollbar-gutte: Opening a drawer adds a [scrollbar-gutter](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/scrollbar-gutter) to the page to avoid layout shift on operating systems that have a fixed scrollbar.
If you don't want to use this feature, [: If you don't want to use this feature, [you can exclude `rootscrollgutter`](/docs/config/#exclude).
For pagination, we use [join component](: For pagination, we use [join component](/components/join) to show multiple links or buttons next to each other.
Items in each rating should have unique: Items in each rating should have unique `name` attributes to avoid conflicts with other ratings on the same page.
daisyUI includes styles for 3 popular ca: daisyUI includes styles for 3 popular calendar libraries.
Use any of them, based on your needs.
You don't need to import the CSS files f: You don't need to import the CSS files for these libraries. daisyUI will style them automatically.
Cally is a web component calendar and it: Cally is a web component calendar and it works everywhere. [Read the docs](https://github.com/WickyNilliams/cally)
Pikaday is a JS datepicker library and y: Pikaday is a JS datepicker library and you can use it from CDN or as a JS dependency [Read the docs](https://github.com/Pikaday/Pikaday)
React Day Picker is a flexible date pick: React Day Picker is a flexible date picker component for React. [Read the docs](https://github.com/gpbl/react-day-picker)
Each set of radio inputs should have uni: Each set of radio inputs should have unique `name` attributes to avoid conflicts with other sets of radio inputs on the same page.
`validator-hint` class will be invisible: `validator-hint` class will be invisible if it comes after a `validator` class, then if the input is invalid, `validator-hint` will get visible.
`validator-hint` still occupies space ev: `validator-hint` still occupies space even if it's invisible because we don't want a layout shift when the hint appears.
If you prefer to hide the hint when it's: If you prefer to hide the hint when it's not visible, add `hidden` class to `validator-hint`. It will take no space when it's hidden, and if input is invalid, it will appear and take space.
you need to change the span text and the: you need to change the span text and the `--value` CSS variable using JS. Value must be a number between 0 and 99.
`input` class can be used for any input: `input` class can be used for any input field type. Including `text`, `password`, `email`, `number`, `date`, `datetime-local`, `week`, `month`, `tel`, `url`, `search`, `time`
For `checkbox`, `radio`, `file`, `range`: For `checkbox`, `radio`, `file`, `range` use their own class names, as they are not visually input fields.
Inputs can be used with `validator` clas: Inputs can be used with `validator` class to have validation styles. [See Validator component](/components/validator/) for more details.
we use cookies for no reason.
Accordion uses the same style as the [co: Accordion uses the same style as the [collapse component](/components/collapse/) but it works with radio inputs. You can control which item to be open by checking/unchecking the hidden radio input.
Add \"link\" class to make it look like: Add "link" class to make it look like a
Radial progress needs `--value` CSS vari: Radial progress needs `--value` CSS variable to work.
To change the size, use `--size` CSS var: To change the size, use `--size` CSS variable which has a default value of `5rem`.
To change the thickness, use `--thicknes: To change the thickness, use `--thickness` CSS variable which is 10% of the size by default.
For Radial progress we need to use a `di: For Radial progress we need to use a `div` instead of the `progress` tag because browsers can't show text inside `progress` tag, and Firefox doesn’t render pseudo-elements inside `progress` tag at all.
Adding `role=\"progressbar\"` makes it a: Adding `role="progressbar"` makes it accessible to screen readers as well.
By default, the second child of the `lis: By default, the second child of the `list-row` will fill the remaining space. You can use `list-col-grow` on another child to make it fill the remaining space instead.
Title: Title
Author: Author
Theme Controller changes the theme using: Theme Controller changes the theme using CSS only.
You can then use JS to save the input st: You can then use JS to save the input state in the server or localStorage if you want it to persist on page refresh.
Here's a React example to save checkbox: Here's a React example to save checkbox state in local storage: [Stackblitz](https://stackblitz.com/edit/react-checkbox-localstorage?file=src%2FApp.js)
You can use `w-*` and `h-*` classes to s: You can use `w-*` and `h-*` classes to set the width and height of the stack, making all items the same size.
It needs JS to open but it has better ac: It needs JS to open but it has better accessibility and we can close it using `Esc` key
A link adds a parameter to the URL and y: A link adds a parameter to the URL and you only see the modal when the URL has that parameter
Opening a modal adds a [scrollbar-gutter: Opening a modal adds a [scrollbar-gutter](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/scrollbar-gutter) to the page to avoid layout shift on operating systems that have a fixed scrollbar.
HTML dialog element is a native way to c: HTML dialog element is a native way to create modals. It is accessible and we can close the modal using `Esc` key.
We can open the modal using JS `ID.showM: We can open the modal using JS `ID.showModal()` method and close it using `ID.close()` method.
The ID must be unique for each modal.
When modal is closed, the page will scro: When modal is closed, the page will scroll to the top because of the anchor link.
Anchor links might not work well on some: Anchor links might not work well on some SPA frameworks. If there are problems, use the other methods
The `hr` tag at the beginning or end of: The `hr` tag at the beginning or end of each item, displays a line to connect items.
In chat window type this and write your: In chat window type this and write your prompt
